channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - World

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Mark Sherman and Zeke Miller
item.description: Roe v. Wade is the 1973 Supreme Court decision that legalised abortion nationwide in the United States.
item.title: Roe v Wade US abortion law to be overturned, leaked court decision suggests

item.dc:creator: Amy Chang Chien and Amy Qin
item.description: China’s capital has reopened a 1000-bed hospital first used during the SARS epidemic in 2003.
item.title: Beijing reopens COVID isolation centre to avoid Shanghai-style lockdown

item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall and William Neff
item.description: “The Russians have known about this for 31 years - you have to say they’ve just chosen not to deal with it,” said one US military professor.
item.title: The ‘jack-in-the-box’ flaw that dooms some Russian tanks

item.description: The evacuation of Mariupol continues as Russian artillery continues to pummel Eastern Ukraine.
item.title: Gallery: Ukraine - Russia crisis, May 3rd, 2022

item.description: A US couple has been left shaken up after a black bear charged at them in an attack that was caught on camera.
item.title: Couple charged by bear in viral video

item.dc:creator: Mick Ryan
item.description: China has wrong-footed Australia with its Solomon Islands pact. Regardless of who wins the federal election, a rapid strategic assessment will be needed to adjust our national security priorities.
item.title: China’s deal with the Solomons is an act of colonisation

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: One passenger said he only learned his bags were offloaded at Darwin 15 minutes before landing at Heathrow.
item.title: Dreamliner nightmare as Qantas dumps economy luggage in Darwin for London flights

item.dc:creator: Cara Anna, Inna Varenytsia and Margaryta Chornokondratenko
item.description: Ukraine’s Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said Lavrov’s remarks about Adolf Hitler and Jews showed “the deeply-rooted antisemitism of the Russian elites”.
item.title: ‘I have no words’: Zelensky’s dismay after Russian diplomat claims Hitler was Jewish

item.dc:creator: Soo Youn
item.description: A man’s housework ranged from six to eight hours a week when he was the primary breadwinner but then declined as his wife out-earned him.
item.title: When mothers out-earn their husbands, they gain more housework, study says

item.description: Efforts restart after Russian shelling halted operation.
item.title: Evacuation of hundreds of Ukrainian civilians resume in Mariupol

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: What do you do if the tendril of a poisonous vine threatens to overrun your backyard? You chop it off.
item.title: Island well known to Australia offers one counter to China’s Solomon Islands move

item.dc:creator: Spencer S. Hsu
item.description: Thomas Webster, an NYPD veteran, was the first Capitol riot defendant to be tried on an assault charge and has been convicted on all counts.
item.title: Ex-NYPD officer guilty in first January 6 police assault trial

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: Joseph Day, 31, sent a text to his fiancee on Saturday before vanishing in the city of Bristol.
item.title: ‘Something’s gone wrong’: Kiwi cameraman goes missing in the UK

item.description: The operation to evacuate the steelworks in the Ukrainian city of Mariupol has finally gone ahead.
item.title: Operation to evacuate Mariupol steelworks finally goes ahead

item.dc:creator: Robert D. McFadden
item.description: She claimed to have invented the two-deck turntable nightclub in 1957 to drown out the sounds of patrons “snogging” between sets.
item.title: Disco pioneer Regine, holocaust survivor and 70s nightclub queen, dies aged 92

item.dc:creator: Yudith Ho
item.description: At least one other child has died from acute hepatitis, and more than a dozen others have undergone liver transplants after coming down with the disease.
item.title: Three children died in Indonesia of new liver disease seen across world

item.dc:creator: Hamuda Hassan and Jorge Silva
item.description: Around 100 Ukrainian civilians were being evacuated from a ruined steelworks in the city of Mariupol on Sunday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said.
item.title: As civilians escape from Mariupol’s bunkers, Russia hammers other cities in the east

item.dc:creator: Zhang Yan and Ben Blanchard
item.description: As China’s strict lockdowns plunge the nation’s consumer spending to alarming lows, Taiwan vows not to chase COVID zero any more.
item.title: Tale of two outbreaks: Taiwan calls China’s lockdowns ‘cruel’

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world
